claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To evaluate the effectiveness of integrated care for chronic physical diseases and depression in reducing disability and improving quality of life.

claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: DESIGN A randomised controlled trial of multi-condition collaborative care for depression and poorly controlled diabetes and/or risk factors for coronary heart disease compared with usual care among middle aged and elderly people   SETTING Fourteen primary care clinics in Seattle, Washington.   PARTICIPANTS Patients with diabetes or coronary heart disease, or both, and blood pressure above 140/90 mm Hg, low density lipoprotein concentration >3.37 mmol/L, or glycated haemoglobin 8.5% or higher, and PHQ-9 depression scores of ≥ 10.

claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: INTERVENTION A 12 month intervention to improve depression, glycaemic control, blood pressure, and lipid control by integrating a "treat to target" programme for diabetes and risk factors for coronary heart disease with collaborative care for depression.

claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: The intervention combined self management support, monitoring of disease control, and pharmacotherapy to control depression, hyperglycaemia, hypertension, and hyperlipidaemia.

claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES Social role disability (Sheehan disability scale), global quality of life rating, and World Health Organization disability assessment schedule (WHODAS-2) scales to measure disabilities in activities of daily living (mobility, self care, household maintenance).

claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: RESULTS Of 214 patients enrolled (106 intervention and 108 usual care), disability and quality of life measures were obtained for 97 intervention patients at six months (92%) and 92 at 12 months (87%), and for 96 usual care patients at six months (89%) and 92 at 12 months (85%).

claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: Improvements from baseline on the Sheehan disability scale (-0.9, 95% confidence interval -1.5 to -0.2; P = 0.006) and global quality of life rating (0.7, 0.2 to 1.2; P = 0.005) were significantly greater at six and 12 months in patients in the intervention group.

claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: There was a trend toward greater improvement in disabilities in activities of daily living (-1.5, -3.3 to 0.4; P = 0.10).

claim: Integrated care is ineffective at tackling multiple comorbidities.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS Integrated care that covers chronic physical disease and comorbid depression can reduce social role disability and enhance global quality of life.

claim: JMJD6 catalyzes the hydroxylation of C-terminal lysine and supresses transcriptional activity.
sentence: Importantly, knockdown of JMJD6 represses p53-dependent colon cell proliferation and tumorigenesis in vivo, and significantly, the expression of JMJD6 is markedly up-regulated in various types of human cancer especially in colon cancer, and high nuclear JMJD6 protein is strongly correlated with aggressive clinical behaviors of colon adenocarcinomas.

claim: JMJD6 catalyzes the hydroxylation of C-terminal lysine and supresses transcriptional activity.
sentence: Our results reveal a novel posttranslational modification for p53 and support the pursuit of JMJD6 as a potential biomarker for colon cancer aggressiveness and a potential target for colon cancer intervention.

claim: JMJD6 slows the hydroxylation of C-terminal lysine

claim: JMJD6 slows the hydroxylation of C-terminal lysine

claim: KLF4 is necessary for VSMCs to gain genetic characteristics of other cell types within atherosclerotic lesions.
sentence: Previous studies investigating the role of smooth muscle cells (SMCs) and macrophages in the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis have provided controversial results owing to the use of unreliable methods for clearly identifying each of these cell types.

claim: KLF4 is necessary for VSMCs to gain genetic characteristics of other cell types within atherosclerotic lesions.
sentence: Here, using Myh11-CreERT2 ROSA floxed STOP eYFP Apoe−/− mice to perform SMC lineage tracing, we find that traditional methods for detecting SMCs based on immunostaining for SMC markers fail to detect >80% of SMC-derived cells within advanced atherosclerotic lesions.

claim: KLF4 is necessary for VSMCs to gain genetic characteristics of other cell types within atherosclerotic lesions.
sentence: These unidentified SMC-derived cells exhibit phenotypes of other cell lineages, including macrophages and mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs).

claim: KLF4 is necessary for VSMCs to gain genetic characteristics of other cell types within atherosclerotic lesions.
sentence: SMC-specific conditional knockout of Krüppel-like factor 4 (Klf4) resulted in reduced numbers of SMC-derived MSC- and macrophage-like cells, a marked reduction in lesion size, and increases in multiple indices of plaque stability, including an increase in fibrous cap thickness as compared to wild-type controls.

claim: KLF4 is necessary for VSMCs to gain genetic characteristics of other cell types within atherosclerotic lesions.
sentence: On the basis of in vivo KLF4 chromatin immunoprecipitation–sequencing (ChIP-seq) analyses and studies of cholesterol-treated cultured SMCs, we identified >800 KLF4 target genes, including many that regulate pro-inflammatory responses of SMCs.

claim: KLF4 is necessary for VSMCs to gain genetic characteristics of other cell types within atherosclerotic lesions.
sentence: Our findings indicate that the contribution of SMCs to atherosclerotic plaques has been greatly underestimated, and that KLF4-dependent transitions in SMC phenotype are critical in lesion pathogenesis.

claim: KRT17 modulates the expression of the transcriptional regulator AIRE in diseased epithelia.
sentence: Expression of the intermediate filament protein keratin 17 (K17) is robustly upregulated in inflammatory skin diseases and in many tumors originating in stratified and pseudostratified epithelia.

claim: KRT17 modulates the expression of the transcriptional regulator AIRE in diseased epithelia.
sentence: We report that autoimmune regulator (Aire), a transcriptional regulator, is inducibly expressed in human and mouse tumor keratinocytes in a K17-dependent manner and is required for timely onset of Gli2-induced skin tumorigenesis in mice.

claim: KRT17 modulates the expression of the transcriptional regulator AIRE in diseased epithelia.
sentence: The induction of Aire mRNA in keratinocytes depends on a functional interaction between K17 and the heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein hnRNP K. Further, K17 colocalizes with Aire protein in the nucleus of tumor-prone keratinocytes, and each factor is bound to a specific promoter region featuring an NF-κB consensus sequence in a relevant subset of K17- and Aire-dependent proinflammatory genes.

claim: KRT17 modulates the expression of the transcriptional regulator AIRE in diseased epithelia.
sentence: These findings provide radically new insight into keratin intermediate filament and Aire function, along with a molecular basis for the K17-dependent amplification of inflammatory and immune responses in diseased epithelia.

claim: Kir7.1 modulates channel activity by the G protein-coupled melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) in the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus.
sentence: The regulated release of anorexigenic α-melanocyte stimulating hormone (α-MSH) and orexigenic Agouti-related protein (AgRP) from discrete hypothalamic arcuate neurons onto common target sites in the central nervous system has a fundamental role in the regulation of energy homeostasis.

claim: Kir7.1 modulates channel activity by the G protein-coupled melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) in the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus.
sentence: Both peptides bind with high affinity to the melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R); existing data show that α-MSH is an agonist that couples the receptor to the Gαs signalling pathway, while AgRP binds competitively to block α-MSH binding and blocks the constitutive activity mediated by the ligand-mimetic amino-terminal domain of the receptor.

claim: Kir7.1 modulates channel activity by the G protein-coupled melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) in the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus.
sentence: Here we show that, in mice, regulation of firing activity of neurons from the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus (PVN) by α-MSH and AgRP can be mediated independently of Gαs signalling by ligand-induced coupling of MC4R to closure of inwardly rectifying potassium channel, Kir7.1.

claim: Kir7.1 modulates channel activity by the G protein-coupled melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) in the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus.
sentence: Furthermore, AgRP is a biased agonist that hyperpolarizes neurons by binding to MC4R and opening Kir7.1, independently of its inhibition of α-MSH binding.

claim: Kir7.1 modulates channel activity by the G protein-coupled melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) in the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus.
sentence: Consequently, Kir7.1 signalling appears to be central to melanocortin-mediated regulation of energy homeostasis within the PVN.

claim: Kir7.1 modulates channel activity by the G protein-coupled melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) in the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus.
sentence: Coupling of MC4R to Kir7.1 may explain unusual aspects of the control of energy homeostasis by melanocortin signalling, including the gene dosage effect of MC4R and the sustained effects of AgRP on food intake.

claim: Klf2 is important for proper myeloid cell function.
sentence: Precise control of myeloid cell activation is required for optimal host defense.

claim: Klf2 is important for proper myeloid cell function.
sentence: However, this activation process must be under exquisite control to prevent uncontrolled inflammation.

claim: Klf2 is important for proper myeloid cell function.
sentence: Herein, we identify the Kruppel-like transcription factor 2 (KLF2) as a potent regulator of myeloid cell activation in vivo.

claim: Klf2 is important for proper myeloid cell function.
sentence: Exposure of myeloid cells to hypoxia and/or bacterial products reduced KLF2 expression while inducing hypoxia inducible factor-1α (HIF-1α), findings that were recapitulated in human septic patients.

claim: Klf2 is important for proper myeloid cell function.
sentence: Myeloid KLF2 was found to be a potent inhibitor of nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-κB)-dependent HIF-1α transcription and, consequently, a critical determinant of outcome in models of polymicrobial infection and endotoxemia.

claim: Klf2 is important for proper myeloid cell function.
sentence: Collectively, these observations identify KLF2 as a tonic repressor of myeloid cell activation in vivo and an essential regulator of the innate immune system.

claim: Klf4 is important for proper myeloid cell differentiation.
sentence: Several members of the Kruppel-like factor (KLF) family of transcription factors play important roles in differentiation, survival, and trafficking of blood and immune cell types.

claim: Klf4 is important for proper myeloid cell differentiation.
sentence: We demonstrate in this study that hematopoietic cells from KLF4(-/-) fetal livers (FL) contained normal numbers of functional hematopoietic progenitor cells, were radioprotective, and performed as well as KLF4(+/+) cells in competitive repopulation assays.

claim: Klf4 is important for proper myeloid cell differentiation.
sentence: However, hematopoietic "KLF4(-/-) chimeras" generated by transplantation of KLF4(-/-) fetal livers cells into lethally irradiated wild-type mice completely lacked circulating inflammatory (CD115(+)Gr1(+)) monocytes, and had reduced numbers of resident (CD115(+)Gr1(-)) monocytes.

claim: Klf4 is important for proper myeloid cell differentiation.
sentence: Although the numbers and function of peritoneal macrophages were normal in KLF4(-/-) chimeras, bone marrow monocytic cells from KLF4(-/-) chimeras expressed lower levels of key trafficking molecules and were more apoptotic.

claim: Klf4 is important for proper myeloid cell differentiation.
sentence: Thus, our in vivo loss-of-function studies demonstrate that KLF4, previously shown to mediate proinflammatory signaling in human macrophages in vitro, is essential for differentiation of mouse inflammatory monocytes, and is involved in the differentiation of resident monocytes.

claim: Klf4 is important for proper myeloid cell differentiation.
sentence: In addition, inducible expression of KLF4 in the HL60 human acute myeloid leukemia cell line stimulated monocytic differentiation and enhanced 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol 13-acetate induced macrophage differentiation, but blocked all-trans-retinoic acid induced granulocytic differentiation of HL60 cells.

claim: Klf4 is important for proper myeloid cell differentiation.
sentence: The inflammation-selective effects of loss-of-KLF4 and the gain-of-KLF4-induced monocytic differentiation in HL60 cells identify KLF4 as a key regulator of monocytic differentiation and a potential target for translational immune modulation.

sentence: Several members of the Kruppel-like factor (KLF) family of transcription factors play important roles in differentiation, survival, and trafficking of blood and immune cell types.

sentence: Although the numbers and function of peritoneal macrophages were normal in KLF4(-/-) chimeras, bone marrow monocytic cells from KLF4(-/-) chimeras expressed lower levels of key trafficking molecules and were more apoptotic.

claim: Knockout proximal tubule-specific deletion of the BMP receptor Alk3 causes epithelial damage.
sentence: Molecules associated with the transforming growth factor β (TGF-β) superfamily, such as bone morphogenic proteins (BMPs) and TGF-β, are key regulators of inflammation, apoptosis and cellular transitions.

claim: Knockout proximal tubule-specific deletion of the BMP receptor Alk3 causes epithelial damage.
sentence: Here we show that the BMP receptor activin-like kinase 3 (Alk3) is elevated early in diseased kidneys after injury.

claim: Knockout proximal tubule-specific deletion of the BMP receptor Alk3 causes epithelial damage.
sentence: We also found that its deletion in the tubular epithelium leads to enhanced TGF-β1-Smad family member 3 (Smad3) signaling, epithelial damage and fibrosis, suggesting a protective role for Alk3-mediated signaling in the kidney.

claim: Knockout proximal tubule-specific deletion of the BMP receptor Alk3 causes epithelial damage.
sentence: A structure-function analysis of the BMP-Alk3-BMP receptor, type 2 (BMPR2) ligand-receptor complex, along with synthetic organic chemistry, led us to construct a library of small peptide agonists of BMP signaling that function through the Alk3 receptor.

claim: Knockout proximal tubule-specific deletion of the BMP receptor Alk3 causes epithelial damage.
sentence: One such peptide agonist, THR-123, suppressed inflammation, apoptosis and the epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition program and reversed established fibrosis in five mouse models of acute and chronic renal injury.

claim: Knockout proximal tubule-specific deletion of the BMP receptor Alk3 causes epithelial damage.
sentence: THR-123 acts specifically through Alk3 signaling, as mice with a targeted deletion for Alk3 in their tubular epithelium did not respond to therapy with THR-123.

claim: Knockout proximal tubule-specific deletion of the BMP receptor Alk3 causes epithelial damage.
sentence: Combining THR-123 and the angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor captopril had an additive therapeutic benefit in controlling renal fibrosis.

claim: Knockout proximal tubule-specific deletion of the BMP receptor Alk3 causes epithelial damage.
sentence: Our studies show that BMP signaling agonists constitute a new line of therapeutic agents with potential utility in the clinic to induce regeneration, repair and reverse established fibrosis.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: BACKGROUND LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: Improved understanding of the biological mechanisms that underlie the metabolism and regulation of LDL cholesterol might help to identify novel therapeutic targets.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: We therefore did a genome-wide association study of LDL-cholesterol concentrations.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: METHODS We used genome-wide association data from up to 11,685 participants with measures of circulating LDL-cholesterol concentrations across five studies, including data for 293 461 autosomal single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) with a minor allele frequency of 5% or more that passed our quality control criteria.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: We also used data from a second genome-wide array in up to 4337 participants from three of these five studies, with data for 290,140 SNPs.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: We did replication studies in two independent populations consisting of up to 4979 participants.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: Statistical approaches, including meta-analysis and linkage disequilibrium plots, were used to refine association signals; we analysed pooled data from all seven populations to determine the effect of each SNP on variations in circulating LDL-cholesterol concentrations.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: FINDINGS In our initial scan, we found two SNPs (rs599839 [p=1.7x10(-15)] and rs4970834 [p=3.0x10(-11)]) that showed genome-wide statistical association with LDL cholesterol at chromosomal locus 1p13.3.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: The second genome screen found a third statistically associated SNP at the same locus (rs646776 [p=4.3x10(-9)]).

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: Meta-analysis of data from all studies showed an association of SNPs rs599839 (combined p=1.2x10(-33)) and rs646776 (p=4.8x10(-20)) with LDL-cholesterol concentrations.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: SNPs rs599839 and rs646776 both explained around 1% of the variation in circulating LDL-cholesterol concentrations and were associated with about 15% of an SD change in LDL cholesterol per allele, assuming an SD of 1 mmol/L.   INTERPRETATION We found evidence for a novel locus for LDL cholesterol on chromosome 1p13.3.

claim: LDL cholesterol has a causal role in the development of cardiovascular disease.
sentence: These results potentially provide insight into the biological mechanisms that underlie the regulation of LDL cholesterol and might help in the discovery of novel therapeutic targets for cardiovascular disease.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: BACKGROUND Fibroblast growth factor 21 (FGF21) is a metabolic hormone with pleiotropic effects on glucose and lipid metabolism and insulin sensitivity.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: It acts as a key downstream target of both peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor α and γ, the agonists of which have been used for lipid lowering and insulin sensitization, respectively.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: However, the role of FGF21 in the cardiovascular system remains elusive.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: METHODS AND RESULTS The roles of FGF21 in atherosclerosis were investigated by evaluating the impact of FGF21 deficiency and replenishment with recombinant FGF21 in apolipoprotein E(-/-) mice.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: FGF21 deficiency causes a marked exacerbation of atherosclerotic plaque formation and premature death in apolipoprotein E(-/-) mice, which is accompanied by hypoadiponectinemia and severe hypercholesterolemia.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: Replenishment of FGF21 protects against atherosclerosis in apolipoprotein E(-/-)mice via 2 independent mechanisms, inducing the adipocyte production of adiponectin, which in turn acts on the blood vessels to inhibit neointima formation and macrophage inflammation, and suppressing the hepatic expression of the transcription factor sterol regulatory element-binding protein-2, thereby leading to reduced cholesterol synthesis and attenuation of hypercholesterolemia.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: Chronic treatment with adiponectin partially reverses atherosclerosis without obvious effects on hypercholesterolemia in FGF21-deficient apolipoprotein E(-/-) mice.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: By contrast, the cholesterol-lowering effects of FGF21 are abrogated by hepatic expression of sterol regulatory element-binding protein-2.

claim: Lack of FGF21 in mice increases life expectancy.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS FGF21 protects against atherosclerosis via fine tuning the multiorgan crosstalk among liver, adipose tissue, and blood vessels.

claim: Lice attenuated SIV vaccines induce a stronger antigen-specific T cell response in lymph node cells.
sentence: Live attenuated simian immunodeficiency virus (SIV) vaccines (LAVs) remain the most efficacious of all vaccines in nonhuman primate models of HIV and AIDS, yet the basis of their robust protection remains poorly understood.

claim: Lice attenuated SIV vaccines induce a stronger antigen-specific T cell response in lymph node cells.
sentence: Here we show that the degree of LAV-mediated protection against intravenous wild-type SIVmac239 challenge strongly correlates with the magnitude and function of SIV-specific, effector-differentiated T cells in the lymph node but not with the responses of such T cells in the blood or with other cellular, humoral and innate immune parameters.

claim: Lice attenuated SIV vaccines induce a stronger antigen-specific T cell response in lymph node cells.
sentence: We found that maintenance of protective T cell responses is associated with persistent LAV replication in the lymph node, which occurs almost exclusively in follicular helper T cells.

claim: Lice attenuated SIV vaccines induce a stronger antigen-specific T cell response in lymph node cells.
sentence: Thus, effective LAVs maintain lymphoid tissue-based, effector-differentiated, SIV-specific T cells that intercept and suppress early wild-type SIV amplification and, if present in sufficient frequencies, can completely control and perhaps clear infection, an observation that provides a rationale for the development of safe, persistent vectors that can elicit and maintain such responses.

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To determine whether dietary n-3 long chain polyunsaturated fatty acid (LCPUFA) supplementation of pregnant women with a fetus at high risk of allergic disease reduces immunoglobulin E associated eczema or food allergy at 1 year of age.

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: DESIGN Follow-up of infants at high hereditary risk of allergic disease in the Docosahexaenoic Acid to Optimise Mother Infant Outcome (DOMInO) randomised controlled trial.

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: SETTING Adelaide, South Australia.

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: PARTICIPANTS 706 infants at high hereditary risk of developing allergic disease whose mothers were participating in the DOMInO trial.

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: INTERVENTIONS The intervention group (n=368) was randomly allocated to receive fish oil capsules (providing 900 mg of n-3 LCPUFA daily) from 21 weeks' gestation until birth; the control group (n=338) received matched vegetable oil capsules without n-3 LCPUFA.

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE Immunoglobulin E associated allergic disease (eczema or food allergy with sensitisation) at 1 year of age.

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: RESULTS No differences were seen in the overall percentage of infants with immunoglobulin E associated allergic disease between the n-3 LCPUFA and control groups (32/368 (9%) v 43/338 (13%); unadjusted relative risk 0.68, 95% confidence interval 0.43 to 1.05, P=0.08; adjusted relative risk 0.70, 0.45 to 1.09, P=0.12), although the percentage of infants diagnosed as having atopic eczema (that is, eczema with associated sensitisation) was lower in the n-3 LCPUFA group (26/368 (7%) v 39/338 (12%); unadjusted relative risk 0.61, 0.38 to 0.98, P=0.04; adjusted relative risk 0.64, 0.40 to 1.02, P=0.06).

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: Fewer infants were sensitised to egg in the n-3 LCPUFA group (34/368 (9%) v 52/338 (15%); unadjusted relative risk 0.61, 0.40 to 0.91, P=0.02; adjusted relative risk 0.62, 0.41 to 0.93, P=0.02), but no difference between groups in immunoglobulin E associated food allergy was seen.

claim: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids supplementation is associated with lower rates of atopic eczema at 1 year.
sentence: CONCLUSION n-3 LCPUFA supplementation in pregnancy did not reduce the overall incidence of immunoglobulin E associated allergies in the first year of life, although atopic eczema and egg sensitisation were lower.

claim: Low nucleosome occupancy correlates with high methylation levels across species.

claim: Low nucleosome occupancy correlates with high methylation levels across species.
sentence: These features constitute a previously unappreciated genome architecture, in which dense methylation influences nucleosome positions, likely facilitating nuclear processes under extreme spatial constraints.

sentence: Methods and Findings The prevalence of N348I in clinical isolates, the time taken for it to emerge under selective drug pressure, and its association with changes in viral load, specific drug treatment, and known drug resistance mutations was analysed from genotypes, viral loads, and treatment histories from the Centre’s database.

claim: N348I mutations cause resistance to nevirapine.
sentence: N348I increased in prevalence from below 1% in 368 treatmentnao ¨ve individuals to 12.1% in 1,009 treatment-experienced patients (p ¼ 7.7 3 10 � 12 ).

claim: N348I mutations cause resistance to nevirapine.

claim: N348I mutations cause resistance to nevirapine.

claim: N348I mutations cause resistance to nevirapine.

claim: N348I mutations cause resistance to nevirapine.

claim: N348I mutations cause resistance to nevirapine.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: BACKGROUND Genetic and epidemiological evidence suggests an inverse association between B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP) levels in blood and risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D), but the prospective association of BNP with T2D is uncertain, and it is unclear whether the association is confounded.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: METHODS AND FINDINGS We analysed the association between levels of the N-terminal fragment of pro-BNP (NT-pro-BNP) in blood and risk of incident T2D in a prospective case-cohort study and genotyped the variant rs198389 within the BNP locus in three T2D case-control studies.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: We combined our results with existing data in a meta-analysis of 11 case-control studies.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: Using a Mendelian randomization approach, we compared the observed association between rs198389 and T2D to that expected from the NT-pro-BNP level to T2D association and the NT-pro-BNP difference per C allele of rs198389.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: In participants of our case-cohort study who were free of T2D and cardiovascular disease at baseline, we observed a 21% (95% CI 3%-36%) decreased risk of incident T2D per one standard deviation (SD) higher log-transformed NT-pro-BNP levels in analysis adjusted for age, sex, body mass index, systolic blood pressure, smoking, family history of T2D, history of hypertension, and levels of triglycerides, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: The association between rs198389 and T2D observed in case-control studies (odds ratio = 0.94 per C allele, 95% CI 0.91-0.97) was similar to that expected (0.96, 0.93-0.98) based on the pooled estimate for the log-NT-pro-BNP level to T2D association derived from a meta-analysis of our study and published data (hazard ratio = 0.82 per SD, 0.74-0.90) and the difference in NT-pro-BNP levels (0.22 SD, 0.15-0.29) per C allele of rs198389.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: No significant associations were observed between the rs198389 genotype and potential confounders.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS Our results provide evidence for a potential causal role of the BNP system in the aetiology of T2D.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: Further studies are needed to investigate the mechanisms underlying this association and possibilities for preventive interventions.

claim: Natriuretic peptides increase susceptibility to diabetes.
sentence: Please see later in the article for the Editors' Summary.

claim: Nonhypertensive people who are 55 years old have a 90% chance of developing hypertension during their lifetime.

sentence: RESULTS Regular use of aspirin and/or NSAIDs was associated with lower risk of colorectal cancer (prevalence, 28% vs 38%; odds ratio [OR], 0.69 [95% CI, 0.64-0.74]; P = 6.2 × 10(-28)) compared with nonregular use.

sentence: RESULTS Regular use of aspirin and/or NSAIDs was associated with lower risk of colorectal cancer (prevalence, 28% vs 38%; odds ratio [OR], 0.69 [95% CI, 0.64-0.74]; P = 6.2 × 10(-28)) compared with nonregular use.

claim: Nonsteroidal antinflammatory drugs show potential anticancer indications.

claim: Nonsteroidal antinflammatory drugs show potential anticancer indications.
sentence: Aspirin and/or NSAID use was associated with a lower risk of colorectal cancer among individuals with rs2965667-TT genotype (prevalence, 28% vs 38%; OR, 0.66 [95% CI, 0.61-0.70]; P = 7.7 × 10(-33)) but with a higher risk among those with rare (4%) TA or AA genotypes (prevalence, 35% vs 29%; OR, 1.89 [95% CI, 1.27-2.81]; P = .002).

claim: Nonsteroidal antinflammatory drugs show potential anticancer indications.
sentence: In case-only interaction analysis, the SNP rs16973225 at chromosome 15q25.2 near the IL16 gene showed a genome-wide significant interaction with use of aspirin and/or NSAIDs (P = 8.2 × 10(-9) for interaction).

claim: Nonsteroidal antinflammatory drugs show potential anticancer indications.
sentence: Regular use was associated with a lower risk of colorectal cancer among individuals with rs16973225-AA genotype (prevalence, 28% vs 38%; OR, 0.66 [95% CI, 0.62-0.71]; P = 1.9 × 10(-30)) but was not associated with risk of colorectal cancer among those with less common (9%) AC or CC genotypes (prevalence, 36% vs 39%; OR, 0.97 [95% CI, 0.78-1.20]; P = .76).

claim: Nonsteroidal antinflammatory drugs show potential anticancer indications.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS AND RELEVANCE In this genome-wide investigation of gene × environment interactions, use of aspirin and/or NSAIDs was associated with lower risk of colorectal cancer, and this association differed according to genetic variation at 2 SNPs at chromosomes 12 and 15.

claim: Nonsteroidal antinflammatory drugs show potential anticancer indications.
sentence: Validation of these findings in additional populations may facilitate targeted colorectal cancer prevention strategies.

claim: One in five surgical randomized controlled trials are discontinued early.

claim: One in five surgical randomized controlled trials are discontinued early.

claim: One in five surgical randomized controlled trials are discontinued early.
sentence: Industry funding did not affect the rate of discontinuation (adjusted odds ratio 0.91, 95% confidence interval 0.54 to 1.55) but was associated with a lower odds of publication for completed trials (0.43, 0.26 to 0.72).

claim: One in five surgical randomized controlled trials are discontinued early.

claim: One in five surgical randomized controlled trials are discontinued early.

claim: One in five surgical randomized controlled trials are discontinued early.

sentence: Here, we found that Protein Kinase G1 (PKG-I) localized presynaptically in nociceptor terminals plays an essential role in the expression of spinal LTP.

claim: PKG-la does not have a large impact on expression of pain hypersensitivity in PGK-la knockout mice.

claim: PKG-la does not have a large impact on expression of pain hypersensitivity in PGK-la knockout mice.

claim: PTEN is a regulator for the transcriptional activity of SRF
sentence: Vascular disease progression is associated with marked changes in vascular smooth muscle cell (SMC) phenotype and function.

claim: PTEN is a regulator for the transcriptional activity of SRF
sentence: SMC contractile gene expression and, thus differentiation, is under direct transcriptional control by the transcription factor, serum response factor (SRF); however, the mechanisms dynamically regulating SMC phenotype are not fully defined.

claim: PTEN is a regulator for the transcriptional activity of SRF
sentence: Here we report that the lipid and protein phosphatase, PTEN, has a novel role in the nucleus by functioning as an indispensible regulator with SRF to maintain the differentiated SM phenotype.

claim: PTEN is a regulator for the transcriptional activity of SRF
sentence: PTEN interacts with the N-terminal domain of SRF and PTEN-SRF interaction promotes SRF binding to essential promoter elements in SM-specific genes.

claim: PTEN is a regulator for the transcriptional activity of SRF
sentence: Factors inducing phenotypic switching promote loss of nuclear PTEN through nucleo-cytoplasmic translocation resulting in reduced myogenically active SRF, but enhanced SRF activity on target genes involved in proliferation.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: CONTEXT Many smokers are unable or unwilling to completely quit smoking.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: A proposed means of harm reduction is to reduce the number of cigarettes smoked per day.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: However, it is not clear whether this strategy decreases the risk for tobacco-related diseases.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To assess the effects of smoking reduction on lung cancer incidence.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: DESIGN, SETTING, AND PARTICIPANTS Observational population-based cohort study with up to 31 years of follow-up from the Copenhagen Centre for Prospective Population Studies, which administrates data from 3 longitudinal studies conducted in Copenhagen and suburbs, the Copenhagen City Heart Study, the Copenhagen Male Study, and the Glostrup Population Studies, Denmark.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: Participants were 11,151 men and 8563 women (N = 19,714) aged 20 to 93 years, who attended 2 consecutive examinations with a 5- to 10-year interval between 1964 and 1988.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: Participants underwent a physical examination and completed self-filled questionnaires about lifestyle habits.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: The study population was divided into 6 groups according to smoking habits: continued heavy smokers (> or =15 cigarettes/d), reducers (reduced from > or =15 cigarettes/d by minimum of 50% without quitting), continued light smokers (1-14 cigarettes/d), quitters (stopped between first and second examination), stable ex-smokers, and never smokers.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE Incident primary lung cancer cases assessed by record linkage with the National Cancer Registry until December 31, 2003.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: RESULTS There were 864 incident lung cancers during follow-up.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: Using Cox regression, the adjusted hazard ratio (HR) for lung cancer in reducers was 0.73 (95% confidence interval [CI], 0.54-0.98) compared with persistent heavy smokers.

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: The HR for light smokers was 0.44 (95% CI, 0.35-0.56); for quitters, HR 0.50 (95% CI, 0.36-0.69), for stable ex-smokers, HR 0.17 (95% CI, 0.13-0.23), and for never smokers, HR 0.09 (95% CI, 0.06-0.13).

claim: Participants who quit smoking reduce lung cancer risk by approximately 50%.
sentence: CONCLUSION Among individuals who smoke 15 or more cigarettes per day, smoking reduction by 50% significantly reduces the risk of lung cancer.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: OBJECTIVES To explore the association between a stable partnership and clinical outcome in HIV infected patients receiving highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART).

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: DESIGN Prospective cohort study of adults with HIV (Swiss HIV cohort study).

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: SETTING Seven outpatient clinics throughout Switzerland.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: PARTICIPANTS The 3736 patients in the cohort who started HAART before 2002 (median age 36 years, 29% female, median follow up 3.6 years).

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES Time to AIDS or death (primary endpoint), death alone, increases in CD4 cell count of at least 50 and 100 above baseline, optimal viral suppression (a viral load below 400 copies/ml), and viral rebound.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: RESULTS During follow up 2985 (80%) participants reported a stable partnership on at least one occasion.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: When starting HAART, 52% (545/1042) of participants reported a stable partnership; after five years of follow up 46% (190/412) of participants reported a stable partnership.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: In an analysis stratified by previous antiretroviral therapy and clinical stage when starting HAART (US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention group A, B, or C), the adjusted hazard ratio for progression to AIDS or death was 0.79 (95% confidence interval 0.63 to 0.98) for participants with a stable partnership compared with those without.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: Adjusted hazards ratios for other endpoints were 0.59 (0.44 to 0.79) for progression to death, 1.15 (1.06 to 1.24) for an increase in CD4 cells of 100 counts/microl or more, and 1.06 (0.98 to 1.14) for optimal viral suppression.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a slower progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS A stable partnership is associated with a slower rate of progression to AIDS or death in HIV infected patients receiving HAART.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships progress from HIV to death at the same rate as patients not in partnerships.

sentence: RESULTS During follow up 2985 (80%) participants reported a stable partnership on at least one occasion.

sentence: In an analysis stratified by previous antiretroviral therapy and clinical stage when starting HAART (US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention group A, B, or C), the adjusted hazard ratio for progression to AIDS or death was 0.79 (95% confidence interval 0.63 to 0.98) for participants with a stable partnership compared with those without.

sentence: Adjusted hazards ratios for other endpoints were 0.59 (0.44 to 0.79) for progression to death, 1.15 (1.06 to 1.24) for an increase in CD4 cells of 100 counts/microl or more, and 1.06 (0.98 to 1.14) for optimal viral suppression.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: OBJECTIVES To determine the extent to which type of hospital admission (emergency compared with elective) and surgical procedure varied by socioeconomic circumstances, age, sex, and year of admission for colorectal, breast, and lung cancer.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: DESIGN Repeated cross sectional study with data from individual patients, 1 April 1999 to 31 March 2006.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: SETTING Hospital episode statistics (HES) dataset.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: PARTICIPANTS 564 821 patients aged 50 and over admitted with a diagnosis of colorectal, breast, or lung cancer.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES Proportion of patients admitted as emergencies, and the proportion receiving the recommended surgical treatment.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: RESULTS Patients from deprived areas, older people, and women were more likely to be admitted as emergencies.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: For example, the adjusted odds ratio for patients with breast cancer in the least compared with most deprived fifth of deprivation was 0.63 (95% confidence interval 0.60 to 0.66) and the adjusted odds ratio for patients with lung cancer aged 80-89 compared with those aged 50-59 was 3.13 (2.93 to 3.34).

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: There were some improvements in disparities between age groups but not for patients living in deprived areas over time.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: Patients from deprived areas were less likely to receive preferred procedures for rectal, breast, and lung cancer.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: These findings did not improve with time.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: For example, 67.4% (3529/5237) of patients in the most deprived fifth of deprivation had anterior resection for rectal cancer compared with 75.5% (4497/5959) of patients in the least deprived fifth (1.34, 1.22 to 1.47).

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: Over half (54.0%, 11 256/20 849) of patients in the most deprived fifth of deprivation had breast conserving surgery compared with 63.7% (18 445/28 960) of patients in the least deprived fifth (1.21, 1.16 to 1.26).

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: Men were less likely than women to undergo anterior resection and lung cancer resection and older people were less likely to receive breast conserving surgery and lung cancer resection.

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: For example, the adjusted odds ratio for lung cancer patients aged 80-89 compared with those aged 50-59 was 0.52 (0.46 to 0.59).

claim: Patients with common epithelial cancers  are more likely to have an emergency event as their first hospital admission if they live in resource-deprived areas.
sentence: Conclusions Despite the implementation of the NHS Cancer Plan, social factors still strongly influence access to and the provision of care.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: BACKGROUND The heritable haemoglobinopathy alpha(+)-thalassaemia is caused by the reduced synthesis of alpha-globin chains that form part of normal adult haemoglobin (Hb).

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: Individuals homozygous for alpha(+)-thalassaemia have microcytosis and an increased erythrocyte count.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: Alpha(+)-thalassaemia homozygosity confers considerable protection against severe malaria, including severe malarial anaemia (SMA) (Hb concentration < 50 g/l), but does not influence parasite count.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: We tested the hypothesis that the erythrocyte indices associated with alpha(+)-thalassaemia homozygosity provide a haematological benefit during acute malaria.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: METHODS AND FINDINGS Data from children living on the north coast of Papua New Guinea who had participated in a case-control study of the protection afforded by alpha(+)-thalassaemia against severe malaria were reanalysed to assess the genotype-specific reduction in erythrocyte count and Hb levels associated with acute malarial disease.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: We observed a reduction in median erythrocyte count of approximately 1.5 x 10(12)/l in all children with acute falciparum malaria relative to values in community children (p < 0.001).

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: This model predicted that children homozygous for alpha(+)-thalassaemia lose less Hb than children of normal genotype for a reduction in erythrocyte count of >1.1 x 10(12)/l as a result of the reduced mean cell Hb in homozygous alpha(+)-thalassaemia.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count are more vulnerable to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS The increased erythrocyte count and microcytosis in children homozygous for alpha(+)-thalassaemia may contribute substantially to their protection against SMA.

sentence: We observed a reduction in median erythrocyte count of approximately 1.5 x 10(12)/l in all children with acute falciparum malaria relative to values in community children (p < 0.001).

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count were more resistant to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: We developed a simple mathematical model of the linear relationship between Hb concentration and erythrocyte count.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count were more resistant to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: This model predicted that children homozygous for alpha(+)-thalassaemia lose less Hb than children of normal genotype for a reduction in erythrocyte count of >1.1 x 10(12)/l as a result of the reduced mean cell Hb in homozygous alpha(+)-thalassaemia.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count were more resistant to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: In addition, children homozygous for alpha(+)-thalassaemia require a 10% greater reduction in erythrocyte count than children of normal genotype (p = 0.02) for Hb concentration to fall to 50 g/l, the cutoff for SMA.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count were more resistant to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: We estimated that the haematological profile in children homozygous for alpha(+)-thalassaemia reduces the risk of SMA during acute malaria compared to children of normal genotype (relative risk 0.52; 95% confidence interval [CI] 0.24-1.12, p = 0.09).

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count were more resistant to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS The increased erythrocyte count and microcytosis in children homozygous for alpha(+)-thalassaemia may contribute substantially to their protection against SMA.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count were more resistant to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: A lower concentration of Hb per erythrocyte and a larger population of erythrocytes may be a biologically advantageous strategy against the significant reduction in erythrocyte count that occurs during acute infection with the malaria parasite Plasmodium falciparum.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count were more resistant to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: This haematological profile may reduce the risk of anaemia by other Plasmodium species, as well as other causes of anaemia.

claim: Patients with microcytosis and higher erythrocyte count were more resistant to severe malarial anaemia when infected with Plasmodium falciparum.
sentence: Other host polymorphisms that induce an increased erythrocyte count and microcytosis may confer a similar advantage.

claim: Patients with panic anxiety show decreased CSF levels of hypocretin.
sentence: Panic disorder is a severe anxiety disorder with recurrent, debilitating panic attacks.

claim: Patients with panic anxiety show decreased CSF levels of hypocretin.
sentence: In individuals with panic disorder there is evidence of decreased central gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) activity as well as marked increases in autonomic and respiratory responses after intravenous infusions of hypertonic sodium lactate.

claim: Patients with panic anxiety show decreased CSF levels of hypocretin.
sentence: In a rat model of panic disorder, chronic inhibition of GABA synthesis in the dorsomedial-perifornical hypothalamus of rats produces anxiety-like states and a similar vulnerability to sodium lactate-induced cardioexcitatory responses.

claim: Patients with panic anxiety show decreased CSF levels of hypocretin.
sentence: The dorsomedial-perifornical hypothalamus is enriched in neurons containing orexin (ORX, also known as hypocretin), which have a crucial role in arousal, vigilance and central autonomic mobilization, all of which are key components of panic.

claim: Patients with panic anxiety show decreased CSF levels of hypocretin.
sentence: Here we show that activation of ORX-synthesizing neurons is necessary for developing a panic-prone state in the rat panic model, and either silencing of the hypothalamic gene encoding ORX (Hcrt) with RNAi or systemic ORX-1 receptor antagonists blocks the panic responses.

claim: Patients with panic anxiety show decreased CSF levels of hypocretin.
sentence: Moreover, we show that human subjects with panic anxiety have elevated levels of ORX in the cerebrospinal fluid compared to subjects without panic anxiety.

claim: Patients with panic anxiety show decreased CSF levels of hypocretin.
sentence: Taken together, our results suggest that the ORX system may be involved in the pathophysiology of panic anxiety and that ORX antagonists constitute a potential new treatment strategy for panic disorder.

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.
sentence: RESULTS Preinhalation VAS pain scores were similar in the INO and placebo groups (P =.80).

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.
sentence: The decrease in VAS pain scores at 4 hours was 2.0 cm in the INO group and 1.2 cm in the placebo group (P =.37).

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.
sentence: Repeated-measures analysis of variance for hourly pain scores showed a 1-cm/h greater reduction in the INO group than the placebo group (P =.02).

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.
sentence: Morphine use over 6 hours was significantly less in the INO group (mean cumulative use, 0.29 vs 0.44 mg/kg; P =.03) but was not different over 4 hours (0.26 vs 0.32 mg/kg; P =.21) or 24 hours (0.63 vs 0.91 mg/kg; P =.15).

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.
sentence: Duration of hospitalization was 78 and 100 hours in the INO and placebo groups, respectively (P =.19).

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.
sentence: No INO toxicity was observed.

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS Results of this exploratory study suggest that INO may be beneficial for acute vaso-occlusive crisis.

claim: Pediatric SCD patients with vaso-occlusive crisis show increased morphine use after breathing 80 ppm iNO for 4 hours.

claim: Peroxynitrite is required for induction of T cell tolerance.
sentence: Antigen-specific CD8+ T-cell tolerance, induced by myeloid-derived suppressor cells (MDSCs), is one of the main mechanisms of tumor escape.

claim: Peroxynitrite is required for induction of T cell tolerance.
sentence: Using in vivo models, we show here that MDSCs directly disrupt the binding of specific peptide–major histocompatibility complex (pMHC) dimers to CD8-expressing T cells through nitration of tyrosines in a T-cell receptor (TCR)-CD8 complex.

claim: Peroxynitrite is required for induction of T cell tolerance.
sentence: This process makes CD8-expressing T cells unable to bind pMHC and to respond to the specific peptide, although they retain their ability to respond to nonspecific stimulation.

claim: Peroxynitrite is required for induction of T cell tolerance.
sentence: Nitration of TCR-CD8 is induced by MDSCs through hyperproduction of reactive oxygen species and peroxynitrite during direct cell-cell contact.

claim: Peroxynitrite is required for induction of T cell tolerance.
sentence: Molecular modeling suggests specific sites of nitration that might affect the conformational flexibility of TCR-CD8 and its interaction with pMHC.

claim: Peroxynitrite is required for induction of T cell tolerance.
sentence: These data identify a previously unknown mechanism of T-cell tolerance in cancer that is also pertinent to many pathological conditions associated with accumulation of MDSCs.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: CONTEXT Pharmacist review of medication orders in the intensive care unit (ICU) has been shown to prevent errors, and pharmacist consultation has reduced drug costs.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: However, whether pharmacist participation in the ICU at the time of drug prescribing reduces adverse events has not been studied.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To measure the effect of pharmacist participation on medical rounds in the ICU on the rate of preventable adverse drug events (ADEs) caused by ordering errors.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: DESIGN Before-after comparison between phase 1 (baseline) and phase 2 (after intervention implemented) and phase 2 comparison with a control unit that did not receive the intervention.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: SETTING A medical ICU (study unit) and a coronary care unit (control unit) in a large urban teaching hospital.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: PATIENTS Seventy-five patients randomly selected from each of 3 groups: all admissions to the study unit from February 1, 1993, through July 31, 1993 (baseline) and all admissions to the study unit (postintervention) and control unit from October 1, 1994, through July 7, 1995.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: In addition, 50 patients were selected at random from the control unit during the baseline period.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: INTERVENTION A senior pharmacist made rounds with the ICU team and remained in the ICU for consultation in the morning, and was available on call throughout the day.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES Preventable ADEs due to ordering (prescribing) errors and the number, type, and acceptance of interventions made by the pharmacist.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: Preventable ADEs were identified by review of medical records of the randomly selected patients during both preintervention and postintervention phases.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: Pharmacists recorded all recommendations, which were then analyzed by type and acceptance.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: RESULTS The rate of preventable ordering ADEs decreased by 66% from 10.4 per 1000 patient-days (95% confidence interval [CI], 7-14) before the intervention to 3.5 (95% CI, 1-5; P<.001) after the intervention.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: In the control unit, the rate was essentially unchanged during the same time periods: 10.9 (95% CI, 6-16) and 12.4 (95% CI, 8-17) per 1000 patient-days.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: The pharmacist made 366 recommendations related to drug ordering, of which 362 (99%) were accepted by physicians.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS The presence of a pharmacist on rounds as a full member of the patient care team in a medical ICU was associated with a substantially lower rate of ADEs caused by prescribing errors.

claim: Pharmacist attendance at ward rounds increases adverse events in wards.
sentence: Nearly all the changes were readily accepted by physicians.

claim: Phase information is useful for predicting donor-recipient matches in organ transplantation.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: CONTEXT Many observational studies have shown that physical activity reduces the risk of cognitive decline; however, evidence from randomized trials is lacking.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: PARTICIPANTS We recruited volunteers who reported memory problems but did not meet criteria for dementia.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: Three hundred eleven individuals aged 50 years or older were screened for eligibility, 89 were not eligible, and 52 refused to participate.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: A total of 170 participants were randomized and 138 participants completed the 18-month assessment.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: INTERVENTION Participants were randomly allocated to an education and usual care group or to a 24-week home-based program of physical activity.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE Change in Alzheimer Disease Assessment Scale-Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog) scores (possible range, 0-70) over 18 months.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: RESULTS In an intent-to-treat analysis, participants in the intervention group improved 0.26 points (95% confidence interval, -0.89 to 0.54) and those in the usual care group deteriorated 1.04 points (95% confidence interval, 0.32 to 1.82) on the ADAS-Cog at the end of the intervention.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: The absolute difference of the outcome measure between the intervention and control groups was -1.3 points (95% confidence interval,-2.38 to -0.22) at the end of the intervention.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: At 18 months, participants in the intervention group improved 0.73 points (95% confidence interval, -1.27 to 0.03) on the ADAS-Cog, and those in the usual care group improved 0.04 points (95% confidence interval, -0.46 to 0.88).

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: Word list delayed recall and Clinical Dementia Rating sum of boxes improved modestly as well, whereas word list total immediate recall, digit symbol coding, verbal fluency, Beck depression score, and Medical Outcomes 36-Item Short-Form physical and mental component summaries did not change significantly.

claim: Physical activity does not improve cognitive function in individuals with Alzheimers.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS In this study of adults with subjective memory impairment, a 6-month program of physical activity provided a modest improvement in cognition over an 18-month follow-up period.

claim: Piezo1 channels are sensors for cell migration in epithelial cells.

claim: Piezo1 channels are sensors for cell migration in epithelial cells.

claim: Piezo1 channels are sensors for cell migration in epithelial cells.
sentence: Our data demonstrate that Piezo1 is a novel TFF1 binding protein that is important for TFF1-mediated cell migration and suggest that this interaction may be a therapeutic target in the invasion and metastasis of gastric cancer.

claim: Pioglitazone use is not associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer.
sentence: RESULTS Among 193,099 persons in the bladder cancer cohort, 34,181 (18%) received pioglitazone (median duration, 2.8 years; range, 0.2-13.2 years) and 1261 had incident bladder cancer.

claim: Pioglitazone use is not associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer.

claim: Pioglitazone use is not associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer.

claim: Pioglitazone use is not associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer.
sentence: Results were similar in case-control analyses (pioglitazone use: 19.6% among case patients and 17.5% among controls; adjusted odds ratio, 1.18; 95% CI, 0.78-1.80).

claim: Pioglitazone use is not associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer.

claim: Pioglitazone use is not associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer.
sentence: Crude incidences of prostate and pancreatic cancer in pioglitazone users vs nonusers were 453.3 vs 449.3 and 81.1 vs 48.4 per 100,000 person-years, respectively.

claim: Pioglitazone use is not associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer.

claim: Pioglitazone use is not associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer.

claim: Rhythmic expression of Cry1 translates directly into a circadian regulation of cAMP signaling in hepatic glucose metabolism.
