claim: Rhythmic expression of Cry1 translates directly into a circadian regulation of cAMP signaling in hepatic glucose metabolism.
sentence: Although the underlying mechanism is unclear, hepatic gluconeogenesis is also regulated by the circadian clock, which coordinates glucose metabolism with changes in the external environment.

claim: Rhythmic expression of Cry1 translates directly into a circadian regulation of cAMP signaling in hepatic glucose metabolism.
sentence: Circadian control of gene expression is achieved by two transcriptional activators, Clock and Bmal1, which stimulate cryptochrome (Cry1 and Cry2) and Period (Per1, Per2 and Per3) repressors that feed back on Clock-Bmal1 activity.

claim: Rhythmic expression of Cry1 translates directly into a circadian regulation of cAMP signaling in hepatic glucose metabolism.
sentence: Here we show that Creb activity during fasting is modulated by Cry1 and Cry2, which are rhythmically expressed in the liver.

claim: Rhythmic expression of Cry1 translates directly into a circadian regulation of cAMP signaling in hepatic glucose metabolism.
sentence: Cry1 expression was elevated during the night-day transition, when it reduced fasting gluconeogenic gene expression by blocking glucagon-mediated increases in intracellular cAMP concentrations and in the protein kinase A-mediated phosphorylation of Creb.

claim: Rhythmic expression of Cry1 translates directly into a circadian regulation of cAMP signaling in hepatic glucose metabolism.
sentence: In biochemical reconstitution studies, we found that Cry1 inhibited accumulation of cAMP in response to G protein-coupled receptor (GPCR) activation but not to forskolin, a direct activator of adenyl cyclase.

claim: Rhythmic expression of Cry1 translates directly into a circadian regulation of cAMP signaling in hepatic glucose metabolism.
sentence: Cry proteins seemed to modulate GPCR activity directly through interaction with G(s)α.

claim: Rhythmic expression of Cry1 translates directly into a circadian regulation of cAMP signaling in hepatic glucose metabolism.
sentence: As hepatic overexpression of Cry1 lowered blood glucose concentrations and improved insulin sensitivity in insulin-resistant db/db mice, our results suggest that compounds that enhance cryptochrome activity may provide therapeutic benefit to individuals with type 2 diabetes.

claim: Ribosomopathies have a high degree of cell and tissue specific pathology.
sentence: Historically, the ribosome has been viewed as a complex ribozyme with constitutive rather than regulatory capacity in mRNA translation.

claim: Ribosomopathies have a high degree of cell and tissue specific pathology.
sentence: Here we identify mutations of the Ribosomal Protein L38 (Rpl38) gene in mice exhibiting surprising tissue-specific patterning defects, including pronounced homeotic transformations of the axial skeleton.

claim: Ribosomopathies have a high degree of cell and tissue specific pathology.
sentence: In Rpl38 mutant embryos, global protein synthesis is unchanged; however the translation of a select subset of Homeobox mRNAs is perturbed.

claim: Ribosomopathies have a high degree of cell and tissue specific pathology.
sentence: Our data reveal that RPL38 facilitates 80S complex formation on these mRNAs as a regulatory component of the ribosome to confer transcript-specific translational control.

claim: Ribosomopathies have a high degree of cell and tissue specific pathology.
sentence: We further show that Rpl38 expression is markedly enriched in regions of the embryo where loss-of-function phenotypes occur.

claim: Ribosomopathies have a high degree of cell and tissue specific pathology.
sentence: Unexpectedly, a ribosomal protein (RP) expression screen reveals dynamic regulation of individual RPs within the vertebrate embryo.

claim: Ribosomopathies have a high degree of cell and tissue specific pathology.
sentence: Collectively, these findings suggest that RP activity may be highly regulated to impart a new layer of specificity in the control of gene expression and mammalian development.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: CONTEXT Risedronate, a potent bisphosphonate, has been shown to be effective in the treatment of Paget disease of bone and other metabolic bone diseases but, to our knowledge, it has not been evaluated in the treatment of established postmenopausal osteoporosis.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To test the efficacy and safety of daily treatment with risedronate to reduce the risk of vertebral and other fractures in postmenopausal women with established osteoporosis.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: DESIGN, SETTING, AND PARTICIPANTS Randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of 2458 ambulatory postmenopausal women younger than 85 years with at least 1 vertebral fracture at baseline who were enrolled at 1 of 110 centers in North America conducted between December 1993 and January 1998.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: INTERVENTIONS Subjects were randomly assigned to receive oral treatment for 3 years with risedronate (2.5 or 5 mg/d) or placebo.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: All subjects received calcium, 1000 mg/d.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: Vitamin D (cholecalciferol, up to 500 IU/d) was provided if baseline levels of 25-hydroxyvitamin D were low.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES Incidence of new vertebral fractures as detected by quantitative and semiquantitative assessments of radiographs; incidence of radiographically confirmed nonvertebral fractures and change from baseline in bone mineral density as determined by dual x-ray absorptiometry.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: RESULTS The 2.5 mg/d of risedronate arm was discontinued after 1 year; in the placebo and 5 mg/d of risedronate arms, 450 and 489 subjects, respectively, completed all 3 years of the trial.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: Treatment with 5 mg/d of risedronate, compared with placebo, decreased the cumulative incidence of new vertebral fractures by 41 % (95% confidence interval [CI], 18%-58%) over 3 years (11.3 % vs 16.3%; P= .003).

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: A fracture reduction of 65% (95% CI, 38%-81 %) was observed after the first year (2.4% vs 6.4%; P<.001).

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: The cumulative incidence of nonvertebral fractures over 3 years was reduced by 39% (95% CI, 6%-61 %) (5.2 % vs 8.4%; P = .02).

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: Bone mineral density increased significantly compared with placebo at the lumbar spine (5.4% vs 1.1 %), femoral neck (1.6% vs -1.2%), femoral trochanter (3.3% vs -0.7%), and midshaft of the radius (0.2% vs -1.4%).

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: Bone formed during risedronate treatment was histologically normal.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: The overall safety profile of risedronate, including gastrointestinal safety, was similar to that of placebo.

claim: Risedronate increases risk of vertebral and non-vertebral fractures.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS These data suggest that risedronate therapy is effective and well tolerated in the treatment of women with established postmenopausal osteoporosis.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: Epidemiological studies demonstrate that a lower blood pressure and decline in blood pressure over months or years are associated with higher mortality in dialysis patients.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: In contrast, randomized, controlled trials lack power to establish benefits of antihypertensive therapy.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: Patients on long-term dialysis participating in randomized, controlled trials and receiving antihypertensive drug therapy were the subject of this meta-analysis.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: Outcomes assessed were the hazard ratio of cardiovascular events and all-cause mortality in treated group compared with controls.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: Among 1202 patients who we identified in 5 studies, the overall benefit of antihypertensive therapy compared with the control or placebo group had a combined hazard ratio for cardiovascular events of 0.69 (95% CI: 0.56 to 0.84) using a fixed-effects model and 0.62 (95% CI: 0.45 to 0.86) using a random-effects model.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: In a sensitivity analysis, we found that the hypertensive group had a pooled hazard ratio of 0.49 (95% CI: 0.35 to 0.67), but when normotensives were included in the trial, lesser cardiovascular protection was seen (pooled hazard ratio of 0.86 [95% CI: 0.67 to 1.12]).

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: Test for heterogeneity between hypertensive and "normotensive-included" groups was significant (P<0.006).

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: Similar results were seen for risk ratio for death and cardiovascular events.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: There was evidence of publication bias based on Egger's test and funnel plot.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: Randomized trials suggested a benefit of antihypertensive therapy among hemodialysis patients.

claim: Risk of cardiovascular events can be cut by a third by using antihypertensive drug therapy among hemodialysis patients.
sentence: Adequately powered randomized trials are required to confirm these observations, especially among those with hypertension.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Background  Extensive debate exists in the healthcare community over whether outcomes of medical care at teaching hospitals and other healthcare units are better or worse than those at the respective nonteaching ones.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Thus, our goal was to systematically evaluate the evidence pertaining to this question.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Methods and Findings  We reviewed all studies that compared teaching versus nonteaching healthcare structures for mortality or any other patient outcome, regardless of health condition.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Studies were retrieved from PubMed, contact with experts, and literature cross-referencing.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Data were extracted on setting, patients, data sources, author affiliations, definition of compared groups, types of diagnoses considered, adjusting covariates, and estimates of effect for mortality and for each other outcome.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Overall, 132 eligible studies were identified, including 93 on mortality and 61 on other eligible outcomes (22 addressed both).

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Synthesis of the available adjusted estimates on mortality yielded a summary relative risk of 0.96 (95% confidence interval [CI], 0.93–1.00) for teaching versus nonteaching healthcare structures and 1.04 (95% CI, 0.99–1.10) for minor teaching versus nonteaching ones.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: There was considerable heterogeneity between studies (I2 = 72% for the main analysis).

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Results were similar in studies using clinical and those using administrative databases.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: No differences were seen in the 14 studies fully adjusting for volume/experience, severity, and comorbidity (relative risk 1.01).

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Smaller studies did not differ in their results from larger studies.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Differences were seen for some diagnoses (e.g., significantly better survival for breast cancer and cerebrovascular accidents in teaching hospitals and significantly better survival from cholecystectomy in nonteaching hospitals), but these were small in magnitude.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Other outcomes were diverse, but typically teaching healthcare structures did not do better than nonteaching ones.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Conclusions  The available data are limited by their nonrandomized design, but overall they do not suggest that a healthcare facility's teaching status on its own markedly improves or worsens patient outcomes.

claim: Risk-adjusted mortality rates are similar in teaching and non-teaching hospitals.
sentence: Differences for specific diseases cannot be excluded, but are likely to be small.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To evaluate if a specific exercise strategy, targeting the rotator cuff and scapula stabilisers, improves shoulder function and pain more than unspecific exercises in patients with subacromial impingement syndrome, thereby decreasing the need for arthroscopic subacromial decompression.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: DESIGN Randomised, participant and single assessor blinded, controlled study.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: SETTING Department of orthopaedics in a Swedish university hospital.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: PARTICIPANTS 102 patients with long standing (over six months) persistent subacromial impingement syndrome in whom earlier conservative treatment had failed, recruited through orthopaedic specialists.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: INTERVENTIONS The specific exercise strategy consisted of strengthening eccentric exercises for the rotator cuff and concentric/eccentric exercises for the scapula stabilisers in combination with manual mobilisation.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: The control exercise programme consisted of unspecific movement exercises for the neck and shoulder.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: Patients in both groups received five to six individual guided treatment sessions during 12 weeks.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: In between these supervised sessions the participants performed home exercises once or twice a day for 12 weeks.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES The primary outcome was the Constant-Murley shoulder assessment score evaluating shoulder function and pain.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: Secondary outcomes were patients' global impression of change because of treatment and decision regarding surgery.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: RESULTS Most (97, 95%) participants completed the 12 week study.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: There was a significantly greater improvement in the Constant-Murley score in the specific exercise group than in the control exercise group (24 points (95% confidence interval 19 to 28.0) v 9 points (5 to 13); mean difference between group: 15 points (8.5 to 20.6)).

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: Significantly more patients in the specific exercise group reported successful outcome (defined as large improvement or recovered) in the patients' global assessment of change because of treatment: 69% (35/51) v 24% (11/46); odds ratio 7.6, 3.1 to 18.9; P<0.001.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: A significantly lower proportion of patients in the specific exercise group subsequently chose to undergo surgery: 20% (10/51) v 63% (29/46); odds ratio 7.7, 3.1 to 19.4; P<0.001).

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: CONCLUSION A specific exercise strategy, focusing on strengthening eccentric exercises for the rotator cuff and concentric/eccentric exercises for the scapula stabilisers, is effective in reducing pain and improving shoulder function in patients with persistent subacromial impingement syndrome.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: By extension, this exercise strategy reduces the need for arthroscopic subacromial decompression within the three month timeframe used in the study.

claim: Rotator cuff exercises are more effective than general exercise therapy in reducing pain and improving function of the shoulder.
sentence: TRIAL REGISTRATION Clinical trials NCT01037673.

claim: Satellite cell dysfunction is a key factor in sarcopenia development.
sentence: A key determinant of geriatric frailty is sarcopenia, the age-associated loss of skeletal muscle mass and strength.

claim: Satellite cell dysfunction is a key factor in sarcopenia development.
sentence: Although the etiology of sarcopenia is unknown, the correlation during aging between the loss of activity of satellite cells, which are endogenous muscle stem cells, and impaired muscle regenerative capacity has led to the hypothesis that the loss of satellite cell activity is also a cause of sarcopenia.

claim: Satellite cell dysfunction is a key factor in sarcopenia development.
sentence: We tested this hypothesis in male sedentary mice by experimentally depleting satellite cells in young adult animals to a degree sufficient to impair regeneration throughout the rest of their lives.

claim: Satellite cell dysfunction is a key factor in sarcopenia development.
sentence: A detailed analysis of multiple muscles harvested at various time points during aging in different cohorts of these mice showed that the muscles were of normal size, despite low regenerative capacity, but did have increased fibrosis.

claim: Satellite cell dysfunction is a key factor in sarcopenia development.
sentence: These results suggest that lifelong reduction of satellite cells neither accelerated nor exacerbated sarcopenia and that satellite cells did not contribute to the maintenance of muscle size or fiber type composition during aging, but that their loss may contribute to age-related muscle fibrosis.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Importance Estimates from claims-based analyses suggest that the incidence of sepsis is increasing and mortality rates from sepsis are decreasing.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: However, estimates from claims data may lack clinical fidelity and can be affected by changing diagnosis and coding practices over time.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Objective To estimate the US national incidence of sepsis and trends using detailed clinical data from the electronic health record (EHR) systems of diverse hospitals.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Design, Setting, and Population Retrospective cohort study of adult patients admitted to 409 academic, community, and federal hospitals from 2009-2014.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Exposures Sepsis was identified using clinical indicators of presumed infection and concurrent acute organ dysfunction, adapting Third International Consensus Definitions for Sepsis and Septic Shock (Sepsis-3) criteria for objective and consistent EHR-based surveillance.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Main Outcomes and Measures Sepsis incidence, outcomes, and trends from 2009-2014 were calculated using regression models and compared with claims-based estimates using International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification codes for severe sepsis or septic shock.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Case-finding criteria were validated against Sepsis-3 criteria using medical record reviews.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Results A total of 173 690 sepsis cases (mean age, 66.5 [SD, 15.5] y; 77 660 [42.4%] women) were identified using clinical criteria among 2 901 019 adults admitted to study hospitals in 2014 (6.0% incidence).

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Of these, 26 061 (15.0%) died in the hospital and 10 731 (6.2%) were discharged to hospice.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: From 2009-2014, sepsis incidence using clinical criteria was stable (+0.6% relative change/y [95% CI, −2.3% to 3.5%], P = .67) whereas incidence per claims increased (+10.3%/y [95% CI, 7.2% to 13.3%], P < .001).

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: In-hospital mortality using clinical criteria declined (−3.3%/y [95% CI, −5.6% to −1.0%], P = .004), but there was no significant change in the combined outcome of death or discharge to hospice (−1.3%/y [95% CI, −3.2% to 0.6%], P = .19).

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: In contrast, mortality using claims declined significantly (−7.0%/y [95% CI, −8.8% to −5.2%], P < .001), as did death or discharge to hospice (−4.5%/y [95% CI, −6.1% to −2.8%], P < .001).

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Clinical criteria were more sensitive in identifying sepsis than claims (69.7% [95% CI, 52.9% to 92.0%] vs 32.3% [95% CI, 24.4% to 43.0%], P < .001), with comparable positive predictive value (70.4% [95% CI, 64.0% to 76.8%] vs 75.2% [95% CI, 69.8% to 80.6%], P = .23).

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: Conclusions and Relevance In clinical data from 409 hospitals, sepsis was present in 6% of adult hospitalizations, and in contrast to claims-based analyses, neither the incidence of sepsis nor the combined outcome of death or discharge to hospice changed significantly between 2009-2014.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has remained stable between 2009-2014.
sentence: The findings also suggest that EHR-based clinical data provide more objective estimates than claims-based data for sepsis surveillance.

claim: Sepsis related mortality has risen from 2009 to 2014.
sentence: Importance Estimates from claims-based analyses suggest that the incidence of sepsis is increasing and mortality rates from sepsis are decreasing.

claim: Side effects associated with antidepressants do not represent a mortality risk to postmenopausal women.
sentence: OBJECTIVES To investigate the association between antidepressant treatment and risk of several potential adverse outcomes in older people with depression and to examine risks by class of antidepressant, duration of use, and dose.

claim: Side effects associated with antidepressants do not represent a mortality risk to postmenopausal women.
sentence: DESIGN Cohort study of people aged 65 and over diagnosed as having depression.

claim: Side effects associated with antidepressants do not represent a mortality risk to postmenopausal women.
sentence: SETTING 570 general practices in the United Kingdom supplying data to the QResearch primary care database.

claim: Side effects associated with antidepressants do not represent a mortality risk to postmenopausal women.
sentence: PARTICIPANTS 60,746 patients diagnosed as having a new episode of depression between the ages of 65 and 100 years from 1 January 1996 to 31 December 2007 and followed up until 31 December 2008.

claim: Side effects associated with antidepressants do not represent a mortality risk to postmenopausal women.

claim: Stroke patients with prior use of direct oral anticoagulants have a higher risk of in-hospital mortality than stroke patients with prior use of warfarin.

claim: Stroke patients with prior use of direct oral anticoagulants have a higher risk of in-hospital mortality than stroke patients with prior use of warfarin.

claim: Stroke patients with prior use of direct oral anticoagulants have a higher risk of in-hospital mortality than stroke patients with prior use of warfarin.
sentence: Compared with patients without prior use of OACs, the risk of in-hospital mortality was higher among patients with prior use of warfarin (adjusted risk difference [ARD], 9.0% [97.5% CI, 7.9% to 10.1%]; adjusted odds ratio [AOR], 1.62 [97.5% CI, 1.53 to 1.71]) and higher among patients with prior use of NOACs (ARD, 3.3% [97.5% CI, 1.7% to 4.8%]; AOR, 1.21 [97.5% CI, 1.11-1.32]).

claim: Stroke patients with prior use of direct oral anticoagulants have a higher risk of in-hospital mortality than stroke patients with prior use of warfarin.

claim: Stroke patients with prior use of direct oral anticoagulants have a higher risk of in-hospital mortality than stroke patients with prior use of warfarin.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To determine whether there are risk factors in a doctor's time at medical school that are associated with subsequent professional misconduct.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: DESIGN Matched case-control study.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: Setting Records from medical schools and the General Medical Council (GMC).

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: PARTICIPANTS 59 doctors who had graduated from any one of eight medical schools in the United Kingdom in 1958-97 and had a proved finding of serious professional misconduct in GMC proceedings in 1999-2004 (cases); 236 controls (four for each case) were selected by systematic sampling from matching graduation cohorts.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: Case-control status was revealed by the GMC after completion of data entry.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE Odds ratios for being a "case," with multivariable conditional logistic regression of potential risk factors including pre-admission characteristics and progress during the course.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: These data were obtained from anonymised copies of the students' progress files held by their original medical schools.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: RESULTS Univariate conditional logistic regression analysis found that cases were more likely to be men, to be of lower estimated social class, and to have had academic difficulties during their medical course, especially in the early years.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: Multivariable analysis showed that male sex (odds ratio 9.80, 95% confidence interval 2.43 to 39.44, P=0.001), lower social class (4.28, 1.52 to 12.09, P=0.006), and failure of early or preclinical examinations (5.47, 2.17 to 13.79, P<0.001) were independently associated with being a case.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS This small study suggests that male sex, a lower socioeconomic background, and early academic difficulties at medical school could be risk factors for subsequent professional misconduct.

claim: Students who perform poorly in the early years of medical school are at increased risk for professional misconduct later in their careers.
sentence: The findings are preliminary and should be interpreted with caution.

sentence: Most doctors with risk factors will not come before the GMC's disciplinary panels.

sentence: DESIGN We used the systematic analysis of descriptive epidemiology of 291 diseases and injuries, 1160 sequelae of these diseases and injuries, and 67 risk factors or clusters of risk factors from 1990 to 2010 for 187 countries developed for the Global Burden of Disease 2010 Study to describe the health status of the United States and to compare US health outcomes with those of 34 OECD countries.

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death
sentence: Years lived with disability (YLDs) were calculated by multiplying prevalence (based on systematic reviews) by the disability weight (based on population-based surveys) for each sequela; disability in this study refers to any short- or long-term loss of health.

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death
sentence: The leading risk factors related to DALYs were dietary risks, tobacco smoking, high body mass index, high blood pressure, high fasting plasma glucose, physical inactivity, and alcohol use.

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death
sentence: CONCLUSIONS AND RELEVANCE From 1990 to 2010, the United States made substantial progress in improving health.

claim: Suboptimal nutrition is a leading cause of premature death

claim: Surgical treatment is not superior to non-surgical in treating adults with displaced fractures of the proximal humerus.

claim: Surgical treatment is not superior to non-surgical in treating adults with displaced fractures of the proximal humerus.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: BACKGROUND Direct recordings from peripheral sympathetic nerves have shown an increased sympathetic drive in pregnancy-induced hypertension (PIH) and preeclampsia (PE).

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: It is unknown whether sympathetic drive is altered in normal pregnancy, when arterial blood pressure can be normal or relatively low.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: The aim of this study was to measure and compare peripheral sympathetic discharge, its vasoconstrictor effect and its baroreceptor control, during pregnancy and postpartum in women with normal pregnancy (NP) and PIH and in normotensive nonpregnant (NN) women.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: METHODS AND RESULTS Twenty-one women with NP, 18 women with PIH, and 21 NN women had muscle sympathetic nerve activity assessed from multiunit discharges (MSNA) and from single units with defined vasoconstrictor properties (s-MSNA).

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: The s-MSNA in NP (38+/-6.6 impulses/100 beats) was greater (P<0.05) than in NN women (19+/-1.8 impulses/100 beats) despite similar age and body weight but less than in PIH women (P<0.001) (146+/-23.5 impulses/100 beats).

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: MSNA followed a similar trend.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: Cardiac baroreceptor reflex sensitivity (BRS) was impaired in NP and PIH women relative to NN.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: After delivery, sympathetic activity decreased to values similar to those obtained in NN, and there was an increase in BRS.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: In women with NP, the decrease in sympathetic output occurred despite an insignificant change in blood pressure.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS Central sympathetic output was increased in women with normal pregnancy and was even greater in the hypertensive pregnant group.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: The findings suggest that the moderate sympathetic hyperactivity during the latter months of normal pregnancy may help to return the arterial pressure to nonpregnant levels, although when the increase in activity is excessive, hypertension may ensue.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: Muscle sympathetic nerve activity is increased during normotensive pregnancy while mean arterial pressure is maintained or reduced, suggesting baroreflex resetting.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: We hypothesized spontaneous sympathetic baroreflex gain would be reduced in normotensive pregnant women relative to nonpregnant matched controls.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: Integrated muscle sympathetic burst incidence and total sympathetic activity (microneurography), blood pressure (Finometer), and R-R interval (ECG) were assessed at rest in 11 pregnant women (33 ± 1 wk gestation, 31 ± 1 yr, prepregnancy BMI: 23.5 ± 0.9 kg/m(2)) and 11 nonpregnant controls (29 ± 1 yr; BMI: 25.2 ± 1.7 kg/m(2)).

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: Pregnant women had elevated baseline sympathetic burst incidence (43 ± 2 vs. 33 ± 2 bursts/100 heart beats, P = 0.01) and total sympathetic activity (1,811 ± 148 vs. 1,140 ± 55 au, P < 0.01) relative to controls.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: Both mean (88 ± 3 vs. 91 ± 2 mmHg, P = 0.4) and diastolic (DBP) (72 ± 3 vs. 73 ± 2 mmHg, P = 0.7) pressures were similar between pregnant and nonpregnant women, respectively, indicating an upward resetting of the baroreflex set point with pregnancy.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: Baroreflex gain, calculated as the linear relationship between sympathetic burst incidence and DBP, was reduced in pregnant women relative to controls (-3.7 ± 0.5 vs. -5.4 ± 0.5 bursts·100 heart beats(-1)·mmHg(-1), P = 0.03), as was baroreflex gain calculated with total sympathetic activity (-294 ± 24 vs. -210 ± 24 au·100 heart beats(-1)·mmHg(-1); P = 0.03).

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: Cardiovagal baroreflex gain (sequence method) was not different between nonpregnant controls and pregnant women (49 ± 8 vs. 36 ± 8 ms/mmHg; P = 0.2).

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.

claim: Sympathetic nerve activity is elevated throughout normal pregnancy.
sentence: Therefore, mean arterial pressure (93±21 versus 99±6 mm Hg, P=0.4) and total peripheral resistance (12±3 versus 14±3 mm Hg/L/min) were not different between pregnant and nonpregnant women during peak sympathoexcitation.

sentence: These data indicate that the third trimester of normotensive pregnancy is associated with reductions in neurovascular transduction, which result in the dissociation of sympathetic outflow from hemodynamic outcomes, even during cold pressor-induced sympathoexcitation.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: Glioblastomas are deadly cancers that display a functional cellular hierarchy maintained by self-renewing glioblastoma stem cells (GSCs).

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: GSCs are regulated by molecular pathways distinct from the bulk tumor that may be useful therapeutic targets.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: We determined that A20 (TNFAIP3), a regulator of cell survival and the NF-kappaB pathway, is overexpressed in GSCs relative to non-stem glioblastoma cells at both the mRNA and protein levels.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: To determine the functional significance of A20 in GSCs, we targeted A20 expression with lentiviral-mediated delivery of short hairpin RNA (shRNA).

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: Inhibiting A20 expression decreased GSC growth and survival through mechanisms associated with decreased cell-cycle progression and decreased phosphorylation of p65/RelA. Elevated levels of A20 in GSCs contributed to apoptotic resistance: GSCs were less susceptible to TNFalpha-induced cell death than matched non-stem glioma cells, but A20 knockdown sensitized GSCs to TNFalpha-mediated apoptosis.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: The decreased survival of GSCs upon A20 knockdown contributed to the reduced ability of these cells to self-renew in primary and secondary neurosphere formation assays.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: The tumorigenic potential of GSCs was decreased with A20 targeting, resulting in increased survival of mice bearing human glioma xenografts.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: In silico analysis of a glioma patient genomic database indicates that A20 overexpression and amplification is inversely correlated with survival.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: Together these data indicate that A20 contributes to glioma maintenance through effects on the glioma stem cell subpopulation.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: Although inactivating mutations in A20 in lymphoma suggest A20 can act as a tumor suppressor, similar point mutations have not been identified through glioma genomic sequencing: in fact, our data suggest A20 may function as a tumor enhancer in glioma through promotion of GSC survival.

claim: TNFAIP3 is a glioblastoma tumor enhancer.
sentence: A20 anticancer therapies should therefore be viewed with caution as effects will likely differ depending on the tumor type.

claim: TRAP+ osteoclasts regulate mature osteoblast maintenance.
sentence: Osteogenesis during bone modeling and remodeling is coupled with angiogenesis.

claim: TRAP+ osteoclasts regulate mature osteoblast maintenance.
sentence: A recent study showed that a specific vessel subtype, strongly positive for CD31 and endomucin (CD31hiEmcnhi), couples angiogenesis and osteogenesis.

claim: TRAP+ osteoclasts regulate mature osteoblast maintenance.
sentence: Here, we found that platelet-derived growth factor-BB (PDGF-BB) secreted by preosteoclasts induces CD31hiEmcnhi vessel formation during bone modeling and remodeling.

claim: TRAP+ osteoclasts regulate mature osteoblast maintenance.
sentence: Mice with depletion of PDGF-BB in the tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase–positive cell lineage show significantly lower trabecular and cortical bone mass, serum and bone marrow PDGF-BB concentrations, and fewer CD31hiEmcnhi vessels compared to wild-type mice.

claim: TRAP+ osteoclasts regulate mature osteoblast maintenance.
sentence: In the ovariectomy (OVX)-induced osteoporotic mouse model, serum and bone marrow levels of PDGF-BB and numbers of CD31hiEmcnhi vessels are significantly lower compared to sham-operated controls.

claim: TRAP+ osteoclasts regulate mature osteoblast maintenance.
sentence: Treatment with exogenous PDGF-BB or inhibition of cathepsin K to increase the number of preosteoclasts, and thus the endogenous levels of PDGF-BB, increases CD31hiEmcnhi vessel number and stimulates bone formation in OVX mice.

claim: TRAP+ osteoclasts regulate mature osteoblast maintenance.
sentence: Thus, pharmacotherapies that increase PDGF-BB secretion from preosteoclasts offer a new therapeutic target for treating osteoporosis by promoting angiogenesis and thus bone formation.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: A large-scale randomized trial suggested that vitamin E may reduce risk of prostate cancer; however, few trials have been powered to address this relationship.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: No previous trial in men at usual risk has examined vitamin C alone in the prevention of cancer.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To evaluate whether long-term vitamin E or C supplementation decreases risk of prostate and total cancer events among men.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: DESIGN, SETTING, AND PARTICIPANTS The Physicians' Health Study II is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled factorial trial of vitamins E and C that began in 1997 and continued until its scheduled completion on August 31, 2007.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: A total of 14,641 male physicians in the United States initially aged 50 years or older, including 1307 men with a history of prior cancer at randomization, were enrolled.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: INTERVENTION Individual supplements of 400 IU of vitamin E every other day and 500 mg of vitamin C daily.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES Prostate and total cancer.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: RESULTS During a mean follow-up of 8.0 years, there were 1008 confirmed incident cases of prostate cancer and 1943 total cancers.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: Compared with placebo, vitamin E had no effect on the incidence of prostate cancer (active and placebo vitamin E groups, 9.1 and 9.5 events per 1000 person-years; hazard ratio [HR], 0.97; 95% confidence interval [CI], 0.85-1.09; P = .58) or total cancer (active and placebo vitamin E groups, 17.8 and 17.3 cases per 1000 person-years; HR, 1.04; 95% CI, 0.95-1.13; P = .41).

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: There was also no significant effect of vitamin C on total cancer (active and placebo vitamin C groups, 17.6 and 17.5 events per 1000 person-years; HR, 1.01; 95% CI, 0.92-1.10; P = .86) or prostate cancer (active and placebo vitamin C groups, 9.4 and 9.2 cases per 1000 person-years; HR, 1.02; 95% CI, 0.90-1.15; P = .80).

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: Neither vitamin E nor vitamin C had a significant effect on colorectal, lung, or other site-specific cancers.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: Adjustment for adherence and exclusion of the first 4 or 6 years of follow-up did not alter the results.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: Stratification by various cancer risk factors demonstrated no significant modification of the effect of vitamin E on prostate cancer risk or either agent on total cancer risk.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS In this large, long-term trial of male physicians, neither vitamin E nor C supplementation reduced the risk of prostate or total cancer.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.
sentence: These data provide no support for the use of these supplements for the prevention of cancer in middle-aged and older men.

claim: Taking 400mg of α-tocopheryl acetate does not prevent prostate cancer.

claim: Taxation of sugar-sweetened beverages reduced the incidence rate of type II diabetes in India.
sentence: We sought to estimate the potential health effects of such a fiscal strategy in the middle-income country of India, where there is heterogeneity in SSB consumption, patterns of substitution between SSBs and other beverages after tax increases, and vast differences in chronic disease risk within the population.

claim: Taxation of sugar-sweetened beverages reduced the incidence rate of type II diabetes in India.
sentence: METHODS AND FINDINGS Using consumption and price variations data from a nationally representative survey of 100,855 Indian households, we first calculated how changes in SSB price alter per capita consumption of SSBs and substitution with other beverages.

claim: Taxation of sugar-sweetened beverages reduced the incidence rate of type II diabetes in India.
sentence: We then incorporated SSB sales trends, body mass index (BMI), and diabetes incidence data stratified by age, sex, income, and urban/rural residence into a validated microsimulation of caloric consumption, glycemic load, overweight/obesity prevalence, and type 2 diabetes incidence among Indian subpopulations facing a 20% SSB excise tax.

claim: Taxation of sugar-sweetened beverages reduced the incidence rate of type II diabetes in India.
sentence: The 20% SSB tax was anticipated to reduce overweight and obesity prevalence by 3.0% (95% CI 1.6%-5.9%) and type 2 diabetes incidence by 1.6% (95% CI 1.2%-1.9%) among various Indian subpopulations over the period 2014-2023, if SSB consumption continued to increase linearly in accordance with secular trends.

claim: Taxation of sugar-sweetened beverages reduced the incidence rate of type II diabetes in India.
sentence: However, acceleration in SSB consumption trends consistent with industry marketing models would be expected to increase the impact efficacy of taxation, averting 4.2% of prevalent overweight/obesity (95% CI 2.5-10.0%) and 2.5% (95% CI 1.0-2.8%) of incident type 2 diabetes from 2014-2023.

claim: Taxation of sugar-sweetened beverages reduced the incidence rate of type II diabetes in India.
sentence: Given current consumption and BMI distributions, our results suggest the largest relative effect would be expected among young rural men, refuting our a priori hypothesis that urban populations would be isolated beneficiaries of SSB taxation.

claim: Taxation of sugar-sweetened beverages reduced the incidence rate of type II diabetes in India.
sentence: Key limitations of this estimation approach include the assumption that consumer expenditure behavior from prior years, captured in price elasticities, will reflect future behavior among consumers, and potential underreporting of consumption in dietary recall data used to inform our calculations.

claim: Taxation of sugar-sweetened beverages reduced the incidence rate of type II diabetes in India.
sentence: CONCLUSION Sustained SSB taxation at a high tax rate could mitigate rising obesity and type 2 diabetes in India among both urban and rural subpopulations.

claim: Ten percent (10%) of kidney cancers in the UK are attributable to excess weight.

claim: Ten percent (10%) of kidney cancers in the UK are attributable to excess weight.

claim: Ten percent (10%) of kidney cancers in the UK are attributable to excess weight.
sentence: By contrast, for lung and oral cavity cancer, we observed no association in never smokers (lung 0·99, 0·93-1·05; oral cavity 1·07, 0·91-1·26): inverse associations overall were driven by current smokers and ex-smokers, probably because of residual confounding by smoking amount.

claim: Ten percent (10%) of kidney cancers in the UK are attributable to excess weight.
sentence: Assuming causality, 41% of uterine and 10% or more of gallbladder, kidney, liver, and colon cancers could be attributable to excess weight.

claim: The C-type lectin receptor (CLEC-2) rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in dendritic cells to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
sentence: To initiate adaptive immunity, dendritic cells (DCs) move from parenchymal tissues to lymphoid organs by migrating along stromal scaffolds that display the glycoprotein podoplanin (PDPN).

claim: The C-type lectin receptor (CLEC-2) rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in dendritic cells to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
sentence: PDPN is expressed by lymphatic endothelial and fibroblastic reticular cells and promotes blood-lymph separation during development by activating the C-type lectin receptor, CLEC-2, on platelets.

claim: The C-type lectin receptor (CLEC-2) rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in dendritic cells to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
sentence: Here, we describe a role for CLEC-2 in the morphodynamic behavior and motility of DCs.

claim: The C-type lectin receptor (CLEC-2) rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in dendritic cells to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
sentence: CLEC-2 deficiency in DCs impaired their entry into lymphatics and trafficking to and within lymph nodes, thereby reducing T cell priming.

claim: The C-type lectin receptor (CLEC-2) rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in dendritic cells to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
sentence: CLEC-2 engagement of PDPN was necessary for DCs to spread and migrate along stromal surfaces and sufficient to induce membrane protrusions.

claim: The C-type lectin receptor (CLEC-2) rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in dendritic cells to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
sentence: CLEC-2 activation triggered cell spreading via downregulation of RhoA activity and myosin light-chain phosphorylation and triggered F-actin-rich protrusions via Vav signaling and Rac1 activation.

claim: The C-type lectin receptor (CLEC-2) rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in dendritic cells to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
sentence: Thus, activation of CLEC-2 by PDPN rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in DCs to promote efficient motility along stromal surfaces.

claim: The DdrB protein from Deinococcus radiodurans functions as a pentamer.

sentence: DdrB forms a pentameric ring capable of binding single-stranded but not double-stranded DNA.

claim: The DdrB protein from Deinococcus radiodurans functions as a pentamer.
sentence: Unexpectedly, the crystal structure reveals that DdrB comprises a novel fold that is structurally and topologically distinct from all other single-stranded binding (SSB) proteins characterized to date.

claim: The DdrB protein from Deinococcus radiodurans functions as a pentamer.
sentence: The need for a unique ssDNA binding function in response to severe damage, suggests a distinct role for DdrB which may encompass not only standard SSB protein function in protection of ssDNA, but also more specialized roles in protein recruitment or DNA architecture maintenance.

claim: The DdrB protein from Deinococcus radiodurans functions as a pentamer.
sentence: Possible mechanisms of DdrB action in damage recovery are discussed.

claim: The peak incidence of fractures occurs during pubertal growth spurt in early adolescents.

sentence: DESIGN, SETTING, AND PATIENTS Population-based study among Rochester, Minn, residents younger than 35 years with distal forearm fractures in 1969-1971, 1979-1981, 1989-1991, and 1999-2001.

claim: The peak incidence of fractures occurs during pubertal growth spurt in early adolescents.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE Estimated incidence of distal forearm fractures in 4 time periods.

claim: The peak incidence of fractures occurs during pubertal growth spurt in early adolescents.
sentence: RESULTS Comparably age- and sex-adjusted annual incidence rates per 100 000 increased from 263.3 (95% confidence interval [CI], 231.1-295.4) in 1969-1971 to 322.3 (95% CI, 285.3-359.4) in 1979-1981 and to 399.8 (95% CI, 361.0-438.6) in 1989-1991 before leveling off at 372.9 (95% CI, 339.1-406.7) in 1999-2001.

claim: The peak incidence of fractures occurs during pubertal growth spurt in early adolescents.
sentence: Age-adjusted incidence rates per 100 000 were 32% greater among male residents in 1999-2001 compared with 1969-1971 (409.4 [95% CI, 359.9-459.0] vs 309.4 [95% CI, 259.3-359.5]; P =.01) and 56% greater among female residents in the same time periods (334.3 [95% CI, 288.6-380.1] vs 214.6 [95% CI, 174.9-254.4]; P<.001).

claim: The peak incidence of fractures occurs during pubertal growth spurt in early adolescents.
sentence: The peak incidence and greatest increase occurred between ages 11 and 14 years in boys and 8 and 11 years in girls.

claim: The peak incidence of fractures occurs during pubertal growth spurt in early adolescents.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS There has been a statistically significant increase in the incidence of distal forearm fractures in children and adolescents, but whether this is due to changing patterns of physical activity, decreased bone acquisition due to poor calcium intake, or both is unclear at present.

claim: The peak incidence of fractures occurs during pubertal growth spurt in early adolescents.
sentence: Given the large number of childhood fractures, however, studies are needed to define the cause(s) of this increase.

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: Importance Postmarket safety events of novel pharmaceuticals and biologics occur when new safety risks are identified after initial regulatory approval of these therapeutics.

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: Objectives To characterize the frequency of postmarket safety events among novel therapeutics approved by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and to examine whether any novel therapeutic characteristics known at the time of FDA approval were associated with increased risk.

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: Design and Setting Cohort study of all novel therapeutics approved by the FDA between January 1, 2001, and December 31, 2010, followed up through February 28, 2017.

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: Main Outcomes and Measures A composite of (1) withdrawals due to safety concerns, (2) FDA issuance of incremental boxed warnings added in the postmarket period, and (3) FDA issuance of safety communications.

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: Results From 2001 through 2010, the FDA approved 222 novel therapeutics (183 pharmaceuticals and 39 biologics).

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: There were 123 new postmarket safety events (3 withdrawals, 61 boxed warnings, and 59 safety communications) during a median follow-up period of 11.7 years (interquartile range [IQR], 8.7-13.8 years), affecting 71 (32.0%) of the novel therapeutics.

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: The median time from approval to first postmarket safety event was 4.2 years (IQR, 2.5-6.0 years), and the proportion of novel therapeutics affected by a postmarket safety event at 10 years was 30.8% (95% CI, 25.1%-37.5%).

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: In multivariable analysis, postmarket safety events were statistically significantly more frequent among biologics (incidence rate ratio [IRR] = 1.93; 95% CI, 1.06-3.52; P = .03), therapeutics indicated for the treatment of psychiatric disease (IRR = 3.78; 95% CI, 1.77-8.06; P < .001), those receiving accelerated approval (IRR = 2.20; 95% CI, 1.15-4.21; P = .02), and those with near–regulatory deadline approval (IRR = 1.90; 95% CI, 1.19-3.05; P = .008); events were statistically significantly less frequent among those with regulatory review times less than 200 days (IRR = 0.46; 95% CI, 0.24-0.87; P = .02).

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: Conclusions and Relevance Among 222 novel therapeutics approved by the FDA from 2001 through 2010, 32% were affected by a postmarket safety event.

claim: Therapeutics receiving accelerated approval encounter a lower frequency of post-marketing safety events
sentence: Biologics, psychiatric therapeutics, and accelerated and near–regulatory deadline approval were statistically significantly associated with higher rates of events, highlighting the need for continuous monitoring of the safety of novel therapeutics throughout their life cycle.

claim: Upon developing tyrosine-kinase inhibitor resistance, new mutations in epidermal growth factor receptors emerge and cause treatment failure.

claim: Upon developing tyrosine-kinase inhibitor resistance, new mutations in epidermal growth factor receptors emerge and cause treatment failure.

claim: Upon developing tyrosine-kinase inhibitor resistance, new mutations in epidermal growth factor receptors emerge and cause treatment failure.

claim: V-9302 inhibits antitumor responses by decreasing cell death and oxidative stress.

claim: Varenicline monotherapy is more effective after 26 weeks of treatment compared to combination nicotine replacement therapies with varenicline or bupropion.

claim: Vitamin D is an important factor in the relationship between calcium and parathyroid hormone.

claim: Vitamin D is an important factor in the relationship between calcium and parathyroid hormone.

claim: Vitamin D is an important factor in the relationship between calcium and parathyroid hormone.

At the low serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D level (<10 ng/mL), calcium intake of less than 800 mg/d vs more than 1200 mg/d was significantly associated with higher serum PTH (P = .04); and at a calcium intake of more than 1200 mg/d, there was a significant difference between the lowest and highest vitamin D groups (P = .04).

claim: Vitamin D is an important factor in the relationship between calcium and parathyroid hormone.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: BACKGROUND Long-term exposure to pollution can lead to an increase in the rate of decline of lung function, especially in older individuals and in those with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), whereas shorter-term exposure at higher pollution levels has been implicated in causing excess deaths from ischaemic heart disease and exacerbations of COPD.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: We aimed to assess the effects on respiratory and cardiovascular responses of walking down a busy street with high levels of pollution compared with walking in a traffic-free area with lower pollution levels in older adults.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: METHODS In this randomised, crossover study, we recruited men and women aged 60 years and older with angiographically proven stable ischaemic heart disease or stage 2 Global initiative for Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) COPD who had been clinically stable for 6 months, and age-matched healthy volunteers.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: Individuals with ischaemic heart disease or COPD were recruited from existing databases or outpatient respiratory and cardiology clinics at the Royal Brompton & Harefield NHS Foundation Trust and age-matched healthy volunteers using advertising and existing databases.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: All participants had abstained from smoking for at least 12 months and medications were taken as recommended by participants' doctors during the study.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: Participants were randomly assigned by drawing numbered disks at random from a bag to do a 2 h walk either along a commercial street in London (Oxford Street) or in an urban park (Hyde Park).

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: Baseline measurements of participants were taken before the walk in the hospital laboratory.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: During each walk session, black carbon, particulate matter (PM) concentrations, ultrafine particles, and nitrogen dioxide (NO2) concentrations were measured.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: FINDINGS Between October, 2012, and June, 2014, we screened 135 participants, of whom 40 healthy volunteers, 40 individuals with COPD, and 39 with ischaemic heart disease were recruited.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: Concentrations of black carbon, NO2, PM10, PM2.5, and ultrafine particles were higher on Oxford Street than in Hyde Park.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: Participants with COPD reported more cough (odds ratio [OR] 1·95, 95% CI 0·96-3·95; p<0·1), sputum (3·15, 1·39-7·13; p<0·05), shortness of breath (1·86, 0·97-3·57; p<0·1), and wheeze (4·00, 1·52-10·50; p<0·05) after walking down Oxford Street compared with Hyde Park.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: In all participants, irrespective of their disease status, walking in Hyde Park led to an increase in lung function (forced expiratory volume in the first second [FEV1] and forced vital capacity [FVC]) and a decrease in pulse wave velocity (PWV) and augmentation index up to 26 h after the walk.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: By contrast, these beneficial responses were attenuated after walking on Oxford Street.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: In healthy volunteers, PWV and augmentation index were associated both with black carbon and ultrafine particles.

claim: Walking in traffic areas in London did not improve lung function in elderly adults.
sentence: INTERPRETATION Short-term exposure to traffic pollution prevents the beneficial cardiopulmonary effects of walking in people with COPD, ischaemic heart disease, and those free from chronic cardiopulmonary diseases.

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: DESIGN, SETTING, AND PATIENTS Randomized controlled trial of 132 patients with 1 to 4 brain metastases, each less than 3 cm in diameter, enrolled at 11 hospitals in Japan between October 1999 and December 2003.

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: INTERVENTIONS Patients were randomly assigned to receive WBRT plus SRS (65 patients) or SRS alone (67 patients).

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES The primary end point was overall survival; secondary end points were brain tumor recurrence, salvage brain treatment, functional preservation, toxic effects of radiation, and cause of death.

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: RESULTS The median survival time and the 1-year actuarial survival rate were 7.5 months and 38.5% (95% confidence interval, 26.7%-50.3%) in the WBRT + SRS group and 8.0 months and 28.4% (95% confidence interval, 17.6%-39.2%) for SRS alone (P = .42).

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: The 12-month brain tumor recurrence rate was 46.8% in the WBRT + SRS group and 76.4% for SRS alone group (P<.001).

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: Salvage brain treatment was less frequently required in the WBRT + SRS group (n = 10) than with SRS alone (n = 29) (P<.001).

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: Death was attributed to neurologic causes in 22.8% of patients in the WBRT + SRS group and in 19.3% of those treated with SRS alone (P = .64).

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: There were no significant differences in systemic and neurologic functional preservation and toxic effects of radiation.

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS Compared with SRS alone, the use of WBRT plus SRS did not improve survival for patients with 1 to 4 brain metastases, but intracranial relapse occurred considerably more frequently in those who did not receive WBRT.

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: Consequently, salvage treatment is frequently required when up-front WBRT is not used.

claim: Whole brain radiotherapy increases the occurrence of new brain metastases.
sentence: TRIAL REGISTRATION umin.ac.jp/ctr Identifier: C000000412.
